review_blob: Golden coloured beer, lovely smell: sweet, fruity and yeasty. Tastes the same: first fruity, then malty, then slightly bitter aftertaste. I like it!
This beer truly stinks like the gutter. But fortunately it tastes better: sweet, bitter finish, bit grainy. There are worse pilsener than this, but pity the beer stinks a bit.

Blond, lightly fizzy beer with no foam at all after a few minutes. It smells fruity and grainy, but also a bit weird (maybe a haze of vomit?). The first taste is gorgeous: sweet and grainy, but the aftertaste is quiet bitter. Nice beer, but not awsome.
Smell is strong, grainy and sweet (overripe melon). Appearance: dark amber with heavy head. Taste starts sour-sweet, then coffee, bitter, caramel... a very strong flavour!
beer_name: De Dochter van de Korenaar Embrasse

review_blob:
The extra white had a quiet interesting taste: not that rubbery as the vedett blonde... yuk. 
Colour is awful: sort of watery whiteblond with no head at all. Taste is better, sweet, grainy (though a bit watery as well).
Local supermarket. Not a firm head. colour is amber, transparant. Tastes sweet (not at all sour as a gueuze should be, but hey, Im more into sweetness than sourness) Lightley grainy and sparkling.
Blonde, hazy beer with a head thats stays a while. Lightly sparkling. Strong smell of grain, even a light odour of vomit. Because of that the taste isnt perfect, but still tasty.
Got this from the local supermarket. Ferm Head that quietly faints. Smell is sweet and grainy. Tastes like herbs (grain, alcohol and a bit of coriander). Nice beer.
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2009

I thought the appearance is weak: no head at all, but that has certainly something do with the glass I poured it in (not the special Kwak glass where the head stays longer). the smell of alcohol was definitly overwhelming, and fruits.
The taste was fortunately better than that. Fruity, sweet and less alcoholic than the smell. Its a reasonably good beer and the presentation with the special glasses makes the experience even better. But not the best of its kind.

bottle 33 cl. clear orange colour with a thick head that stays for while. THe taste is very powerfull (because of the amount of alcohol I guess) and reminds me more of a dark beer: hops, a pinch of caramel and fruits. Rather bitter aftertaste, but the tastes of sweetness and bitterness complete eachother.

bottle 25cl.
soft yellow colour and a thick white head that stays while drinking the beer. It smells like wheats and fruits (maybe peach) and a bit like vomit as well. The taste is powerless: a light detection of wheats.
UPDATED: MAY 26, 2009

Bottle 33 cl. colour is golden orange with a lovely head.The beer started to foam heavily when pouring it out(the second time I experience this with a Bieken) and I had to pour it out into two glasses.
Beside this, the beer tasted wonderfull with notes of honey and yeast. Not too bitter, lovely sweetness (and yet not too sweet): a lovely combination of tastes. I really like this stuff!

Bottle, 33 cl. Amazing hoppy, fruity and full aroma. I didnt really like the colour (reddish brown). But nevertheless, the taste is much more important: yeast, spices and a strong aftertaste. Undoubtedly a pleasantly tasting beer!

Lovely beer from the first sip!
The head stays quiet a long time before dissapearing. golden colour.
The aroma smells overwhelming: a lot of wheat and floral hops and a bit of orange. Taste is almost the same as the smell: whea and fruity and very sparkling. My favourite triple? Perhaps?

bottle 25 cl. I drunk it at the Cambrinus caf in Bruges. Amber colour and it tastes like oranges, spices and a little bit of caramel. Not one of my favourite beers, but I definitely would try it again.
Bottle, 33 cl. My boyfriend got it from the local Delhaize. Amazing smell of chestnut and a pinch of caramel. Taste is nice as well: doesnt taste at all like alcohol, caramel and fruity. Lovely!

Bottle, 33 cl.
Lovely golden colour with a nice white head. Nice fruity aroma. Tastes like gold, no serious, like citrus and other fruits and yeast.
Excellent triple. Nothing more to say.

Bottle 33cl. The beer betrays a slight odor of metal, but it isnt overwhelming. Taste is nice: a bit of caramel and a bitter aftertaste. Unfortunateley you can taste the metal and  the Piraat isnt able to hide its alcoholic aftertaste (it rather gives a warm feeling). But overall a pleasant beer to drink.

One word: awesome!
Smells like pears, tastes like heaven (fruity,no alcoholic taste whatsoever). This lovely beer taste lasts long in your mouth. Definitely one of my favourites!

Bottle, 33 cl. 
Smells a bit like metal...
But taste is very nice, a bit sweet and very sparkling. Colour is wonderful.
Undoubtedly the best of the Chimays existing.

bottle, 75 cl. Expensive, but I had to try it out!
I thought this "brut" would taste more like champagne rather than beer, but I was suprised when I tasted it! Much beerlike and so I was a little dissapointed. 
Taste is quiet neutral, not much bitterness. Ideal as an extraordinary and nice aperitive!

Bottle, 25 cl
I dont really like the smell (alcoholic), but what a relief when I tasted the beer! Awesome taste of caramel and candy sugar: sweet and a small twist of bitterness. Very nice!!
Bottle, 75cl. Lovely fresh aroma, also amazing honey-golden colour. Such a shame that the head doesnt last long, but a very nice beer with sweet taste and slightly bitter aftertaste.

Bottle 33 cl. Smells like a cheap pint, but with its nice head (for the first 10 minutes) and lovely colour (maroonish red) nd excellent taste (quiet neutral, but not bitter). I must add that the beer is also very sparkling, first impression of sparkling water. But good beer!

Bottle 33 cl. Smells like sauerkraut. Has a nice head... for like 2 seconds. Taste is better than the smell, but nevertheless not the best I ever drunk. Sorry, I had to fail this beer. But good try of the Thai!
